get.description: List all models available to the user

schema.title: Response Get Model V1 Models  Model Id  Get

post.description: Create a chat completion using OpenAI compatible SDKs or tools.
Create a message using Anthropic's compatible SDKs or tools. Supports both streaming and non-streaming requests.
Creates an image given a prompt.

get.description: Gets the usage balance for an organization.

model.title: Model
model.description: Model ID used to generate the response, like meta/llama-4-scout or moonshotai/kimi-k2-0905. CompileLabs offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance characteristics, and price points. Refer to the model guide to browse and compare available models.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set to true, the model response data will be streamed to the client as it is generated using server-sent events. See the Streaming section below for more information, along with the streaming responses guide for more information on how to handle the streaming events.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description: How the model should use the provided tools. The model can use a specific tool, any available tool, decide by itself, or not use tools at all. The model will automatically decide whether to use tools.

examples.description: Get the current weather in a given location

location.description: The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA

unit.description: Unit for the output - one of (celsius, fahrenheit)

examples.name: get_weather

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

index.title: Index
index.description: The index of the chat completion choice.

message.description: The message generated by the model.

finish_reason.title: Finish Reason
finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens.

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

function.title: Function
function.description: The function that the model called.

model.title: Model
model.description: Model ID used to generate the response, like meta/llama-4-scout or moonshotai/kimi-k2-0905. CompileLabs offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance characteristics, and price points. Refer to the model guide to browse and compare available models.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set to true, the model response data will be streamed to the client as it is generated using server-sent events. See the Streaming section below for more information, along with the streaming responses guide for more information on how to handle the streaming events.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description: Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. required means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'my_function'}}` forces the model to call that tool. none is the default when no tools are present. auto is the default if tools are present.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: A list of tools the model may call. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

response_format.description: Allows to force the model to produce specific output format.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the messages author. One of `system`, `user`, or `assistant`.

content.title: Content
content.description: The contents of the message. `content` is required for all messages, and may be null for assistant messages with function calls.

name.title: Name
name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role. May contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and underscores, with a maximum length of 64 characters.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier of the response.

object.title: Object
object.description: The object type, which is always 'chat.completion'.

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix time in seconds when the response was generated.

model.title: Model
model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

choices.title: Choices
choices.description: The list of chat completion choices.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

tool_calls.title: Tool Calls
tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

parameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the guide for examples, and the JSON Schema reference for documentation about the format. Omitting parameters defines a function with an empty parameter list.

required.title: Required
required.description: which one of the parameter is required

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: A map of property names to their types and descriptions. Each property is an object with 'type' and 'description' fields.

function.description: The function that the model may call.

b64_json.title: B64 Json
b64_json.description: The base64-encoded JSON of the generated image. Default value for image generation models.

revised_prompt.title: Revised Prompt
revised_prompt.description: The revised prompt that was used to generate the image. This may differ from the original prompt if the model made improvements.
examples: A beautiful sunset over mountains with vibrant orange and pink colors

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of the generated image if `response_format` is set to `url` (default value). URLs are only valid for 60 minutes after generation.

Image.title: Image
Image.description: Individual generated image with URL or base64 data and metadata.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s).

model.title: Model
model.description: The model to use for image generation.

background.title: Background
background.description: Allows to set transparency for the background of the generated image(s). This parameter is only supported for gpt-image-1. Must be one of transparent, opaque or auto (default value).

n.title: N
n.description: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10. For dall-e-3, only n=1 is supported.

output_compression.title: Output Compression
output_compression.description: The compression level (0-100%) for the generated images. This parameter is only supported for gpt-image-1 with the webp or jpeg output formats, and defaults to 100.

output_format.title: Output Format
output_format.description: The format in which the generated images are returned. This parameter is only supported for gpt-image-1. Must be one of png, jpeg, or webp.

quality.title: Quality
quality.description: The quality of the image that will be generated. auto (default value) will automatically select the best quality for the given model. high, medium and low are supported for gpt-image-1. hd and standard are supported for dall-e-3. standard is the only option for dall-e-2.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: The format in which generated images with dall-e-2 and dall-e-3 are returned. Must be one of url or b64_json. URLs are only valid for 60 minutes after the image has been generated.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size of the generated images. Must be one of 1024x1024, 1536x1024 (landscape), 1024x1536 (portrait), or auto (default value) for gpt-image-1, one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024 for dall-e-2, and one of 1024x1024, 1792x1024, or 1024x1792 for dall-e-3.

style.title: Style
style.description: The style of the generated images. This parameter is only supported for dall-e-3. Must be one of vivid or natural.

ImageGenerationRequest.title: ImageGenerationRequest
ImageGenerationRequest.description: Request model for image generation endpoint.

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the image was created.

background.title: Background
background.description: The background parameter used for the image generation. Either `transparent` or `opaque`.

data.title: Data
data.description: The list of generated images. Each image contains the URL or base64 data and metadata.

examples.revised_prompt: A beautiful sunset over mountains with vibrant colors

output_format.title: Output Format
output_format.description: The output format of the image generation. Either `png`, `webp`, or `jpeg`.

quality.title: Quality
quality.description: The quality of the image generated. Either `low`, `medium`, or `high`.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size of the image generated. Either `1024x1024` (square), `1024x1536` (portrait), `1536x1024` (landscape), or `1024x768` (landscape). This parameter is only supported for gpt-image-1.

usage.description: The token usage information for the image generation including prompt tokens and completion tokens.

ImagesResponse.title: ImagesResponse
ImagesResponse.description: Response model for image generation containing generated images and metadata.

data.title: Data
data.description: A list of available models that can be used with the API.

examples.author: meta
examples.description: Meta's latest large language model optimized for reasoning and code generation
examples.name: Llama 4 Scout

ListModelsResponseModel.title: ListModelsResponseModel
ListModelsResponseModel.description: Response containing a list of available models.

metric.description: The pricing metric used for billing. Defines what is being charged for.

rate.title: Rate
rate.description: The cost per unit of the metric in USD.

PricingModel.title: PricingModel
PricingModel.description: Pricing information for a specific metric.

json_schema.title: Json Schema
json_schema.description: JSON schema according to https://json-schema.org/specification that can be provided if `'type': 'json_schema'`.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether this is an error result

id.title: Id
id.description: The model identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

author.description: Information about the author or creator of the model.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: A URL-friendly identifier for the model.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the model.

description.title: Description
description.description: A detailed description of the model's capabilities and use cases.
examples: Meta's latest large language model optimized for reasoning and code generation

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the model was created.

owned_by.title: Owned By
owned_by.description: The organization that owns the model.

status.description: The current status of the model (active, inactive, pending, or deleted).

visibility.description: Whether the model is publicly visible or private.

type.description: The type of model (text-to-text or text-to-image).

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.description: The pricing information for different usage metrics.

output_size.title: Output Size
output_size.description: The supported output image sizes for this model.

TextToImageModelResponseModel.title: TextToImageModelResponseModel
TextToImageModelResponseModel.description: Describes a text-to-image model offering that can be used with the API.

id.title: Id
id.description: The model identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

author.description: Information about the author or creator of the model.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: A URL-friendly identifier for the model.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the model.

description.title: Description
description.description: A detailed description of the model's capabilities and use cases.
examples: Meta's latest large language model optimized for reasoning and code generation

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the model was created.

owned_by.title: Owned By
owned_by.description: The organization that owns the model.

status.description: The current status of the model (active, inactive, pending, or deleted).

visibility.description: Whether the model is publicly visible or private.

type.description: The type of model (text-to-text or text-to-image).

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.description: The pricing information for different usage metrics.

context_length.title: Context Length
context_length.description: The maximum number of tokens that can be processed in a single request (input + output).

TextToTextModelResponseModel.title: TextToTextModelResponseModel
TextToTextModelResponseModel.description: Describes a text-to-text model offering that can be used with the API.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the tool. This is how the tool will be called by the model and in tool_use blocks. Required string length: 1 - 128

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of what this tool does. Tool descriptions should be as detailed as possible. The more information that the model has about what the tool is and how to use it, the better it will perform. You can use natural language descriptions to reinforce important aspects of the tool input JSON schema.
examples: Get the current weather in a given location

ToolChoiceFunction.title: ToolChoiceFunction
ToolChoiceFunction.description: Specific tool choice - forces the model to call a particular function.

prompt_tokens.title: Prompt Tokens
prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prompt.

completion_tokens.title: Completion Tokens
completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the generated completion.

total_tokens.title: Total Tokens
total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used in the request (prompt + completion).

tags.name: models
tags.description: List available models and their settings.

tags.name: llm
tags.description: Large Language Model API endpoints. Send chat completions, generate text, and interact with various AI models using OpenAI and Anthropic compatible SDKs.

tags.name: images
tags.description: AI image generation API. Create images using Flux, Stable Diffusion and other image generation models with customizable parameters.

tags.name: usage
tags.description: Monitor API usage, costs, token consumption, and generate reports for users and organizations.
